wikipedia_page.main: William Ernest Lucas  (16 January 1917 – 24 March 2018) was a British RAF officer and long-distance runner who competed in the 1948 Summer Olympics. In 2017, Lucas was noted for having been Britain's oldest living Olympian.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1948 Summer Olympics

response: William Lucas or Bill Lucas may refer to:
*Bill Lucas (academic) (born 1956), social entrepreneur, author, researcher and motivational speaker
*Bill Lucas, 101, British RAF officer and Olympic long-distance runner (1948).Britain’s oldest surviving Olympian Bill Lucas dies
